business.headline: Markets end in red, Gold soars to all-time high and moreSensex and Nifty slipped into the red after early gains dragged by banks and heavyweight counters. Nifty fell below 24,600 marks while Sensex closed at 80,200. Mid-caps as well as the small-cap indices have been outperforming with modest gains.

PNB, Bank of India cut MCLR: What it means for borrowersPunjab National Bank has made small reductions across different loan tenures. The overnight rate has come down from 8.15% to 8%. The one-month MCLR has dropped slightly to 8.25%, while the three-month rate has been reduced to 8.45%.

Luxury EVs may get costlier as tax panel proposes steep GST hike: ReportThe proposal, if approved, would hit global brands such as Tesla, Mercedes-Benz, BMW and BYD the hardest, just as they ramp up their India play.

How extreme weather is driving up India's food pricesExperts warn that climate change is making such weather events more frequent, leading to higher volatility in vegetable prices and overall food inflation.

Sensex, Nifty end in red as financial stocks fall; all eyes on GST Council meetThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 206.61 points to 80,157.88 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 45.45 points lower at 24,579.60.

How much should you save in an emergency fund? Here's the answerWhen crisis knocks, credit cards and loans only add stress. An emergency fund keeps you afloat without debt. The tricky part is figuring out how much you should save. Let's break it down.

Brass city in crisis: Jobs of over 2 lakh Moradabad artisans at risk from US tariffsUS tariffs have struck Moradabad's export-reliant brass industry, freezing shipments, cutting jobs, and throwing the livelihoods of thousands of artisans and workers into immediate jeopardy.

Hope we can reach trade deal with US by November, says Piyush GoyalCommerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said India is holding talks with the United States on a bilateral trade agreement, day after Trump called ties with India "one-sided diaster".

How to take a loan against mutual fund? Follow these stepsNeed quick cash but don't want to sell your mutual funds? You can now take a loan against your investments and get instant funds while keeping your portfolio intact. Here's how.

Can salaried employees change tax regimes while filing ITR?As tax season nears, a common question among employees is whether they can switch from the old tax regime to the new one, or vice versa, while filing their ITR. Understanding the rules can help maximise tax savings.

Earnings from online gaming? Here's how to file ITRThe September 15 ITR deadline is around the corner, and if you earned money from online games like fantasy cricket, rummy, or poker in FY25, it's time to report your winnings to the tax department.

Sebi sets new intraday limits for equity derivatives from October 1. Details hereThe move comes after Sebi's action against US-based high-frequency trading firm Jane Street for using strategies deemed manipulative and harmful to retail investors.

entertainment.headline: Sonakshi Sinha slams online brands for using her photos without permissionSonakshi Sinha has called out online brands for using her social media photos on their websites without permission or usage rights. She urged companies to act ethically and warned them to take down her images before she names them publicly.

Millie Bobby Brown shares first photo of baby girl with Jake BongioviHollywood actor Millie Bobby Brown, best known as Eleven from 'Stranger Things', is embracing life as a young mum at 21. Here's a glimpse into her family life with husband Jake Bongiovi and their baby girl.

Dwayne Johnson's drastic weight loss leaves fans stunned at Venice Film FestivalDwayne 'The Rock' Johnson appeared at the photocall and press conference for his latest film 'The Smashing Machine' where his noticeably leaner physique took many by surprise.

Inspector Zende to Wednesday, new releases on Netflix to watch this weekNetflix is bringing a fresh lineup this week with something for everyone - action, gothic drama, comedy-thriller, and a hard-hitting documentary. Highlights include 'The Fall Guy', 'Wednesday: Season 2 Part 2', 'Inspector Zende', and 'Love Con Revenge'.

FIR filed against Sanjay Leela Bhansali in Bikaner over Love & War disputeAn FIR has been registered against filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali and two others in Bikaner after a man accused them of fraud, misbehaviour, and breach of trust during the making of 'Love & War'.

Naveen Kasturia on Salakaar being a series of firsts, challenges of playing a spyActor Naveen Kasturia steps into his first spy role in the JioHotstar thriller 'Salakaar'. In an exclusive interview, Naveen talks about the challenges of the role.

Mirai: Shriya Saran's first look from Teja Sajja's sci-fi film outAfter 'Retro', Shriya Saran is set to appear in her second film in 2025. 10 days ahead of its release, Teja Sajja unveiled the first look of Saran from their upcoming Telugu sci-fi drama 'Mirai'.

Tridev's Sonam turns 53, eyes comeback with strong roles in films and OTTActor Sonam celebrates her 53rd birthday reflecting on her early Bollywood success and long hiatus. She is now ready to return with meaningful roles in films and OTT platforms, embracing her age and experience.

The Weeknd's Blinding Lights becomes 1st track to cross 5 billion streams on SpotifyThe Weeknd's 'Blinding Lights' has made history as the first song to hit five billion streams on Spotify. This milestone comes shortly after topping Billboard's Top Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs of the 21st Century chart.

From Omi to OG: Pawan Kalyan receives special birthday wish from Emraan HashmiThe makers of 'OG' celebrated Pawan Kalyan's birthday in an unconventional style by releasing a special video featuring Emraan Hashmi's character, Omi. The film will be released globally on September 25, 2025.

Kiran Rao, Biju Toppo back Humans in the Loop before September releaseKiran Rao and Biju Toppo have joined as executive producers for the indie film Humans in the Loop. The film highlights invisible AI labour through an Adivasi woman's story, raising questions about technology and indigenous knowledge.

BTS' Jungkook issues strong warning after fan trespasses at homeBTS member Jungkook has spoken publicly for the first time following a troubling incident with an intruder at his residence, highlighting ongoing privacy concerns faced by K-pop idols.

Baaghi 4: Harnaaz Sandhu's Yeh Mera Husn being compared to Besharam RangFeaturing debutant Harnaaz Sandhu, the song 'Yeh Mera Husn' from the upcoming film 'Baaghi 4' released on Tuesday. Several social media users have compared the song to Deepika Padukone's song 'Besharam Rang'.

Nushrratt Bharuccha visits Mahakaleshwar temple ahead of Uff Ye Siyapaa releaseActor Nushrratt Bharuccha recently participated in Shiv aarti at Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar temple. A video of the actor offering prayers has gone viral.

Lokesh Kanagaraj addresses Rajinikanth's Coolie box office run, audience hypeDirector Lokesh Kanagaraj addresses the underperformance of his film Coolie, describing the challenges of audience expectations and the film's global reception.

Pranit More on Veer Pahariya controversy: Not the reason to do Bigg BossIn an exclusive interaction with India Today, comedian Pranit More addressed his controversy around Veer Pahariya. He stated that the row was not the reason behind his 'Bigg Boss 19' entry.

Lokah makers apologise, to remove dialogue demeaning Bengaluru womenDulquer Salmaan's Wayfarer Films issued an apology to the people of Karnataka over a dialogue demeaning Bengaluru women in 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra'. They also promised to remove the dialogue and expressed regret.

Mohit Suri's Saiyaara holds strong with Rs 581 crore collection amid big releasesMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara', starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has emerged as a box office sensation, grossing Rs 581 crore worldwide in seven weeks. Despite competition from big releases, the romantic musical continues its strong run.

Jackson Wang kicks off sold-out Magic Man 2 World Tour, eyes India stop in 2026Singer Jackson Wang is launching his 'Magic Man 2' World Tour starting with sold-out shows in Bangkok. Fans in India await confirmation of his first-ever concert in the country, highlighting growing demand and excitement.

general news.headline: Umar Khalid's role grave, hurried trial harmful: Court on no bail in Delhi riots caseThe court said Sharjeel Imam and Umar Khalid were the "first ones to act" after the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill was passed, by creating WhatsApp groups and distributing pamphlets in Muslim-populated areas calling for protests and 'chakka-jaams'.

11 killed in suicide bombing at political rally in Pakistan's BalochistanA suicide bombing at a political rally in Quetta killed 11 and injured 18, while a separate militant assault on a paramilitary base in Bannu left 12 dead after a 12-hour battle.

Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange declares big win, ends hunger strikeMaratha quota activist Manoj Jarange launched an indefinite hunger strike at Mumbai's Azad Maidan on August 29, seeking a 10% quota for the Maratha community in government jobs.

We respect Russia-India ties, Pakistan's Shehbaz Sharif tells Putin in ChinaPakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif told Vladimir Putin in Beijing that Islamabad respects Russia's ties with India and seeks stronger relations with Moscow, as both leaders prepared to attend China's World War II anniversary parade.

Turning accident into agenda: The Khalistani playbook at play in AmericaThe Khalistani playbook has long been to look for margins and fractures—places where mainstream communities are vulnerable—and drive a wedge. Gurpatwant Singh Pannun recast a human tragedy on Florida's Turnpike into a Khalistani talking point.

Quarters Live: Alcaraz wins 2nd set vs Lehecka, Pegula reaches semisUS Open 2025, Day 10 Live updates: Carlos Alcaraz has won the first and the second set of his men's singles quarter-final clash against Jiri Lehecka, but the fight between the two has been end to end. Earlier, Jessica Pegula sealed her spot in the semi-finals by beating Barbora Krejcikova.

Let it be your delivery: Karnataka Congress leader's reply to journalist sparks rowDeshpande's response to a journalist's question regarding the lack of a hospital in Joida taluk has drawn widespread criticism for its tone and perceived insensitivity.

North India's deluge of four decades: How swollen Himalayan rivers brought death, distressHimachal Pradesh, Punjab and J&K bore the brunt. The cost: over 400 people dead, more than a million displaced, and losses pegged at Rs 30,000 crore

How Gurugram, developed to unchoke Delhi, chokes in rain every yearEvery monsoon, Gurugram, the so-called Millennium City, turns into a waterworld of struggle and an emblem of apathy. From paralysing traffic snarls to rising dengue cases caused by waterlogging and a broken drainage system, Gurugram has become a symbol of urban civic failure. Planned as a satellite city to ease Delhi's burden, it now suffocates under its own mismanagement, leaving residents helpless.

Floodwater a blessing: Pak's Khawaja Asif's bizarre 'store water in tubs' planIn a video that has gone viral amid the ongoing monsoon fury, Khawaja Asif can be heard advising people to treat floodwaters as a "blessing" and to store them at home in tubs, buckets, and containers rather than letting the waters "go down the drain".

How Rahul Gandhi's bike yatra converted old Pulsar 220 into newDuring Rahul Gandhi's Voter Adhikar Yatra in Bihar's Darbhanga, a dhaba owner's Pulsar 220 went missing after being taken by the leader's security personnel for the bike rally. Days later, the Congress leader gifted him a brand-new Bajaj Pulsar 220 in Patna.

Raging Yamuna reaches 206.36 metres in Delhi amid heavy rainRiver Yamuna has risen to a critical level of 208.36 metres, coming within 0.30 metres of its record flood mark of 208.66 metres, last recorded in 13 July, 2023. Continuous rainfall has also led to a sharp drop in temperatures across the region.

First Made-in-India chip presented to PM Modi: What is Vikram-32?The initial lot of Vikram 3201 devices was successfully validated in space during the PSLV-C60 mission, demonstrating its reliability for future space missions.

IIT Mandi scientists develop scalable tech for wearables, quantum systemsThe development by IIT Mandi scientists is expected to open new opportunities for low-cost, durable, and flexible devices in areas such as wearables, quantum communication, and energy-efficient electronics

Noida and Ghaziabad schools shut today as heavy rain pummels Delhi-NCRSchools in Noida and Ghaziabad will remain closed on September 3 as heavy rain continues to disrupt normal life across Delhi-NCR. The decision has been taken to ensure students' safety in this season.

CBI arrests two in Rs 22 lakh bribery 'reverse trap' after GST officer's complaintThe incident unfolded after the officer, who was probing alleged tax evasion by multiple online companies, was approached by the accused with an offer to favour the firms in exchange for money. Refusing to be complicit, the officer promptly reported the attempt to the CBI, triggering a well-planned operation.

Do kids really need play school, or are parents just caught in the hype?Even though play schools are optional and not a formal requirement, societal pressure often makes parents feel they have no choice but to enrol their child. For many, it has almost become a benchmark of good parenting. But are play schools genuinely worth the hype?

9 IITs see no admissions from top 2,000 rankers: Why are toppers skipping themThe Joint Implementation Committee's (JIC) 2025 seat allotment data based on JEE Advanced shows most of the best scorers choose only a handful of older IITs. Nine IITs have no admits inside rank 2,000. Government is expanding seats, but quality and placements decide long-term value.

Mayday call on Delhi-Indore flight was degraded; no emergency landing: Air IndiaPilots of an Air India flight from Delhi to Indore on Sunday initially declared a "mayday" after receiving a fire indication in the right engine, but later downgraded the alert to a "pan-pan" before safely returning to the departure airport.

Naveen Patnaik raises fertiliser alarm: Why Odisha farmers are in crisisBiju Janata Dal chief Naveen Patnaik says an acute shortage of fertiliser in the ongoing Kharif season threatens the livelihoods of hundreds of thousands of farmers in Odisha

Olive, sunflower, mustard or ghee: Which oil should make it to your kitchen?India consumes more cooking oil than recommended. So, the big question remains: between sunflower, olive, mustard, coconut, ghee, and nut oils, which one should really make it to your kitchen shelf?

Most dangerous city in the world: Trump after deadly Labor Day weekend in ChicagoUS President Donald Trump called Chicago "the most dangerous city in the world" following a Labor Day weekend where 54 people were shot, seven killed, sparking renewed tensions with Illinois officials over crime intervention.

Bengaluru techie, 41, dies after being bitten by snake hiding in his shoeA 41-year-old private firm employee in Bengaluru died after being allegedly bitten by a snake suspected to have hidden inside his shoe, prompting a police investigation.

How much did India gain from Russian oil? Numbers beyond the noiseIndia has saved at least $17 billion by purchasing Russian crude since the commencement of the Russia-Ukraine war in February 2022, according to experts. How did the discounts and overall import volume shift in these three years against Trump's tariffs that India faced?

sports.headline: Supreme Court appoints ex-judge LN Rao to oversee AIFF-FSDL ISL 2025-26 resolutionSupreme Court approves AIFF-FSDL consensual resolution, appointing Justice LN Rao to oversee ISL commercial partner selection. The move ensures a timely 2025-26 Indian football season while averting potential FIFA-AFC suspension.

Grimsby Town fined for unregistered player vs Manchester United: What it meansGrimsby Town has been fined £20,000 for fielding Clarke Oduor just past the EFL registration deadline in their Carabao Cup win over Manchester United. Despite the administrative error, their historic 12-11 penalty victory stands.

Jessica Pegula downs Barbora Krejcikova to storm into 2nd US Open semi finalJessica Pegula made it into her second consecutive US Open semi-final with a straight-sets win over Barbora Krejcikova. She became the first woman to reach consecutive US Open semi-finals without dropping a set since Serena Williams.

ENG vs SA: Markram, Maharaj star in South Africa's thumping 7-wicket winSouth Africa handed England a crushing seven-wicket defeat to England in the first ODI of the three-match series at Headingley, Leeds. Keshav Maharaj was adjudged Player of the Match for his sensational bowling spell of 4/22 in 5.3 overs.

From IPL nets to Supreme Court: Rajasthan Royals' 2012 Sreesanth injury insurance rowThe decade-long S. Sreesanth IPL injury dispute reaches the Supreme Court, with Rajasthan Royals and insurer United India Insurance clashing over pre-existing injuries, insurance claims, and legal obligations, highlighting the complex intersection of cricket and law in India.

A wild summer transfer window: Top picks ft Liverpool-Isak headline act, Guehi the casualtyThe 2025–26 summer transfer window delivered record-breaking moves, dramatic collapses, and strategic signings across Europe. From Liverpool's Isak transfer to Manchester United's rebuild, fans were glued to every twist, making it one of football's most thrilling windows.

Quarters Live: Alcaraz wins 2nd set vs Lehecka, Pegula reaches semisUS Open 2025, Day 10 Live updates: Carlos Alcaraz has won the first and the second set of his men's singles quarter-final clash against Jiri Lehecka, but the fight between the two has been end to end. Earlier, Jessica Pegula sealed her spot in the semi-finals by beating Barbora Krejcikova.

Rohit stuns fans with remarkable transformation ahead of international comebackIndia's ODI captain Rohit Sharma has stunned fans with his remarkable transformation ahead of his international comeback against Australia in October 2025. The opening batter is looking a lot leaner in his viral photographs, having shed some weight ahead of his return.

Home World Cup can be double-edged sword, can't just relax: Former India coachWV Raman has said that the Indian team should not become complacent for the World Cup, as home advantage can also be a double-edged sword. He feels that other teams also play spin well now, and India will have to battle out the challenges against competitors.

Asia Cup Super 4s: India chase 4th crown as China, Korea and Malaysia plot upsetThe Asia Cup 2025 in Rajgir has reached its business end with India aiming for their fourth crown and a passage into the World Cup next year. However, China, Malaysia and defending champions Korea will be out to spoil the party for the hosts.

Earlier, Jessica Pegula sealed her spot in the semi-finals by beating Barbora Krejcikova.

He feels that other teams also play spin well now, and India will have to battle out the challenges against competitors.

Asia Cup Super 4s: India chase 4th crown as China, Korea and Malaysia plot upsetThe Asia Cup 2025 in Rajgir has reached its business end with India aiming for their fourth crown and a passage into the World Cup next year. However, China, Malaysia and defending champions Korea will be out to spoil the party for the hosts.

Had a long chat with Rohit: Irfan Pathan reveals India captain's World Cup plansIrfan Pathan believes age won't stop Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli from playing the 2027 ODI World Cup. Instead, he warns irregular ODI fixtures could make staying match-ready the real challenge for India's legends.

Shubman Gill's return won't put pressure on secure Suryakumar: Irfan PathanFormer India cricketer Irfan Pathan feels the return of Shubman Gill in T20Is won't put any extra pressure on Suryakumar Yadav as he's not an insecure player.

Asia Cup: When India clinched final-ball thriller vs BangladeshIndia won the 2018 Asia Cup final against Bangladesh with a dramatic last-ball victory. The thrilling finish highlighted India's resilience and Jadhav's crucial contribution under pressure.

Special to be in company of Saina and Sindhu: Chirag ShettySatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty won their second BWF World Championship medal in 2025. Chirag, speaking to PTI relished the fact they were in the elite company of PV Sindhu and Saina Nehwal.

Crypto, online money gaming firms barred from BCCI sponsorship raceThe Indian Cricket Board (BCCI) floated the advertisement for lead sponsorship rights on Tuesday, September 2. The body explicitly mentioned that all companies were not allowed to apply as the jersey sponsor of the Indian team.

After Gavaskar criticism, Haddin defends his stance on Shreyas's Asia Cup snubFormer Australia wicketkeeper Brad Haddin has responded to Sunil Gavaskar after the former Indian great criticised overseas cricketers for commenting on Indian cricket matters.

After Dream11 exit, BCCI invites bids for lead sponsor; deadline September 16The BCCI invited bids for Team India's lead sponsorship rights. The Indian cricket banned applications from real-money gaming platforms and crypto companies in the aftermath of the recently-passed online gaming bill.

Special to be in company of Saina and Sindhu: Chirag ShettySatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty won their second BWF World Championship medal in 2025. Chirag, speaking to PTI relished the fact they were in the elite company of PV Sindhu and Saina Nehwal.

Crypto, online money gaming firms barred from BCCI sponsorship raceThe Indian Cricket Board (BCCI) floated the advertisement for lead sponsorship rights on Tuesday, September 2. The body explicitly mentioned that all companies were not allowed to apply as the jersey sponsor of the Indian team.

After Gavaskar criticism, Haddin defends his stance on Shreyas's Asia Cup snubFormer Australia wicketkeeper Brad Haddin has responded to Sunil Gavaskar after the former Indian great criticised overseas cricketers for commenting on Indian cricket matters.

After Dream11 exit, BCCI invites bids for lead sponsor; deadline September 16The BCCI invited bids for Team India's lead sponsorship rights. The Indian cricket banned applications from real-money gaming platforms and crypto companies in the aftermath of the recently-passed online gaming bill.

Erik ten Hag shocked as Leverkusen sack him after two matchesErik ten Hag said Bayer Leverkusen's decision to dismiss him after just two Bundesliga matches in charge came as a complete surprise, adding that the club's hierarchy had not shown him sufficient trust.

Chinese revolution: Why China could be India's biggest threat to Asia Cup gloryThe China men's hockey team continues to make heads turn with their gritty and determined performances across the turf. With an all-round attack and rugged defence, are the Chinese side India's biggest threat to Asia Cup glory?

China are improving, but India clear favourites to win Asia Cup: Roelant OltmansFormer India coach and current China assistant coach Roelant Oltmans feels that India are the clear favourites to win the Asia Cup in Rajgir. Oltmans feels that the rise of the Chinese men's team was inevitable and they're building towards LA Olympics.

Only Virat Kohli can last half of hockey team's training session: Paddy UptonHockey Asia Cup 2025: Mental conditioning coach Paddy Upton, speaking to India Today, discussed his latest stint with the senior men's hockey team. Upton, who worked with the Indian cricket team in the past, talked up the fitness levels of the Hamanpreet Singh-led hockey team.

Hockey Asia Cup daily digest: India make it 3 out of 3 as forwards finally clickIndia produced a statement performance to dismantle Kazakhstan 15-0 to end the pool phase with a 100 percent win record. Ahead of the crucial Super 4s stage, the Indian forwards finally found their groove with field goals finally coming for the hosts in Rajgir.

Shubman Gill, Joe Root are reluctant to bat at No. 3, says Nasser HussainNasser Hussain stated that with Cheteshwar Pujara's retirement, the game has lost a one-of-a-kind old-school batter. He added that Shubman Gill and Joe Root are reluctant to take on the challenging No. 3 position.

Shubman Gill heartbroken by devastation in Punjab due to floods: We will rise upShubman Gill took to social media to mourn the loss of lives and devastation due to floods in Punjab. The Test captain is in Bengaluru, preparing for Asia Cup 2025, starting September 9.

Teary-eyed Osaka recalls watching Gauff post-birth, now beats her at US OpenNaomi Osaka reached the US Open quarterfinals with a straight-sets win over Coco Gauff. After the match, she recalled how she had watched Gauff from the stands after giving birth to her child.

Out-of-favour Pakistan batter Asif Ali retires from international cricket at 33Pakistan middle-order batsman Asif Ali has confirmed that he will continue playing domestic cricket but has decided to retire from international cricket.

Kuldeep's absence felt in England, may get benched again in Asia Cup: ManinderFormer India spinner Maninder Singh feels Kuldeep Yadav is likely to be benched again by the team management in the Asia Cup 2025. The 60-year-old backed Varun Chakravarthy to be India's X-factor in the tournament, starting September 9.

People want your sweaty towels? Iga Swiatek handles 'dumb' question at US OpenUS Open 2025: As she spoke about the furore over a Polish CEO snatching a signed cap from a child at Flushing Meadows, Iga Swiatek was asked by a reporter if she thought it odd that fans might want her sweaty towels as souvenirs.

Cummins to miss Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma's comeback series due to back injuryAustralia's ODI captain Pat Cummins will miss India's much-anticipated white-ball series, which marks the return of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
